required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxygen Consumption After Acute Whole Body Vibration Session
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects on Oxygen Consumption and Blood Flow After a Single Session of Whole Body Vibration

brief_summary.textblock: Noninvasive assessment of VO2 during a single session of whole body vibration and changes in blood flow caused by the acute activity.

detailed_description.textblock: A single whole body vibration session into two groups, a young adults groups and elderly group, booth healthy, will be held with concomitant collection of VO2 consumed during the session, by MetaMax cortex. Immediately after the session, it will be checked peripheral blood flow through US surface in color Doppler mode.

primary_outcome.measure: VO2 through the gas exchange measured by Cortex Metamax
primary_outcome.description: an atoxic mask measure oxygen consumption and carbon dioxide production in ml/kg/min-1, breathe by breathe

primary_outcome.measure: peripheral blood flow through the ultrasound Doppler
primary_outcome.description: a noninvasive evaluate using an ultrasound for measure the blood flow in liters/second

arm_group.description: young adults (20 to 30 years) compare to elderly (60 to 74 years)

intervention.intervention_name: whole body vibration training in vibrating platform in young
whole body vibration training in vibrating platform in elderly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy young adults (between 20 to 30 years) and healthy elderly (between 60 to 74 years), sedentary according International Physical Activity Questionnaire.
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of thrombosis, labyrinthitis, osteoporosis and individuals who have difficulty adapting to the assessment or training protocol.
